abstract.para: This document explains the content of the MMC network plugin configuration file

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The « network » plugin allows the MMC Python API to manage DNS zones and hosts, DHCP subnet and hosts, into a LDAP. Patched version of ISC BIND (with LDAP sdb backend) and ISC DHCP (with LDAP configuration file backend) are needed. PowerDNS support is also available.

Like all MMC related configuration file, its file format is INI style. The file is made of sections, each one starting with a « [sectionname] » header. In each section options can be defined like this « option = value ».

For example:
[section1] option1 = 1 option2 = 2
[section2] option1 = foo option2 = plop

section.title: Configuration file sections
section.para: Here are all the network.ini available sections

section.title: Section « main »
section.para: This sections defines the global options of the network plugin.

section.title: Section « dns »
section.para: This section defines where DNS needed files, directories and LDAP entities are located.
When the plugin starts for the first time, it creates:

listitem.para: the directory bindroot/named.ldap. This directory will contains all zones definitions
the file bindroot/named.conf.ldap. This file will include all the zone definitions stored into bindroot/named.ldap/

row.entry: LDAP DN where the DNS zones are stored
path to the named.ldap directory inside the BIND chroot. Don't set it if BIND is not into a chroot.
path to the BIND configuration file directory
gid which BIND is running ("bind" or "named")
LDAP user DN to use to read zone info
password of the user specified in dnsreader

section.para: Here is an example for BIND on a Mandriva Corporate Server 4:
section.screen: [dns] type = bind dn = ou=DNS,dc=mandriva,dc=com pidfile = /var/lib/named/var/run/named.pid init = /etc/rc.d/init.d/named logfile = /var/log/messages bindroot = /var/lib/named/etc/ bindchrootconfpath = /etc bindgroup = named dnsreader = uid=DNS Reader,ou=System Accounts,dc=mandriva,dc=com dnsreaderpassword = s3cr3t

section.title: Section « dhcp »
section.para: This section defines where DHCP related files and LDAP entities are located.

row.entry: LDAP DN where the DHCP server configuration is stored
path to DHCP service init script
path to DHCP service log file
path to DHCP service leases file
